Stay in-the-know about great career opportunities at RBC. Sign up and get customized info on our latest jobs, career tips and Recruitment events that matter to you.

Expand your limits and create a new future together at RBC. Find out how we use our passion and drive to enhance the well-being of our clients and communities at rbc.com/careers.

title: Data Analyst, Investment Finance
description:
The Data Analyst will be part of the Toronto based Financial Systems & Workflows Team within the Investment Finance Division, reporting to the Manager, Financial Systems & Workflow. The DataAanalyst will support the development of the portfolio analytics capabilities and support BI solutions for the Investment Finance team and its stakeholders to make informed decisions. The Data Analyst will work with various datasets, employ various data analysis techniques, and communicate their findings to stakeholders. To succeed in this role, the ideal individual needs a strong attention to detail and be a team player with a proven ability to build relationships between the business groups. A keen desire to explore new technologies and implement innovative solutions will enhance the success of the role.

CORE RESPONSIBILITIES:

  • Design and develop comprehensive dashboards and reporting leveraging Power BI or similar business intelligence tools
  • Work across functional areas to understand and identify reporting objectives to develop relevant reporting capabilities
  • Collect, cleanse, and process data sets from various sources, including databases, spreadsheets and external sources to ensure accuracy and consistency
  • Identify, analyze, interpret and report on trends or patterns in data sets
  • Review extracts, reports, printouts, and performance indicators to identify, troubleshoot and resolve problems, including data quality, data integrity issues, and follow the divisional data governance policies
  • Explore data sets and draw meaningful conclusions and insights, including identifying critical metrics and KPIs
  • Evaluate, analyze, and recommend potential solutions that enhance analytics and reporting
  • Conduct gap analysis to identify and recommend process improvements that affect data quality
  • Investigate, evaluate and/or propose solutions to identified problems
  • Collaborate with cross-functional teams, including finance, accounting, and IT, to address data-related challenges

QUALIFICATIONS:

  • 3+ years of experience in financial management and investment support environment with exposure to relevant applications and workflow activities
  • University degree in Accounting, Finance, Mathematics, Computer Science, or related discipline
  • Experience with data visualization tools like Power BI, or data visualization libraries
  • Strong proficiency in data analysis tools and programming languages, such as Alteryx, SQL Python or others
  • Strong communication skills (written and verbal) to effectively convey complex findings to non-technical stakeholders
  • Experience in defining, implementing, and supporting innovative business solutions
  • Familiarity with database systems and data storage technologies
  • Experience with machine learning and predictive modeling is an asset
  • Ability to maintain an innovative mindset focused on delivering business value in a fast-paced and dynamic environment

#LI-Hybrid

Our story:

Founded in 1962, OMERS is one of Canada’s largest defined benefit pension plans, with $127.4 billion in net assets as at June 30, 2023. OMERS is a jointly-sponsored pension plan, with more than 1,000 participating employers ranging from large cities to local agencies, and over half a million active, deferred and retired members. OMERS members include union and non-union employees of municipalities, school boards, local boards, transit systems, electrical utilities, emergency services and children’s aid societies across Ontario. Contributions to the Plan are funded equally by members and employers. OMERS teams work in Toronto, London, New York, Amsterdam, Luxembourg, Singapore, Sydney and other major cities across North America and Europe – serving members and employers and originating and managing a diversified portfolio of high-quality investments in public markets, private equity, infrastructure and real estate.

OMERS is committed to having a workforce that reflects the communities in which we live and work. We are an equal opportunity employer committed to a barrier-free recruitment and selection process. At OMERS inclusion and diversity means belonging. How we create a sense of belonging is through our employees and our vast network of Employee Resource Groups. Whether you are passionate about gender, pride, or visible minorities, we have groups that are focused on making a difference in all of our lives.

title: Head, Business Intelligence & Insights
description:
Application Deadline:

10/09/2023

Address:

100 King Street West

Job Family Group:

Data Analytics & Reporting

As Head, Business Intelligence & Insights, you will play a crucial role in shaping our strategic direction by leveraging data to help senior leadership make informed decisions, manage risks, and drive innovation. You will lead a high-performing team and implement business intelligence initiatives that will help BMO Global Asset Management (GAM) deliver an optimal client experience, grow revenue, and drive efficiency. This role requires a leader who is strategic minded, has exceptional technical skills, and has a proven track record of success in building advanced analytics teams and capabilities.

KEY RESPONSIBILITIES

Leadership & Strategy

  • Develop and execute the vision and roadmap for Business Intelligence & Insights capabilities to support BMO GAM growth strategy
  • Collaborate with senior leadership to identify opportunities for data-driven growth and efficiency improvements

Team management

  • Lead and mentor a team of analysts, data scientists, and business intelligence professionals
  • Foster a culture of continuous improvement, innovation, and learning

Insights & Analysis

  • Leverage advanced analytics capabilities (predictive, prescriptive, and machine learning) to uncover patterns, trends, and insights that may not be apparent through traditional descriptive or diagnostic analytics. Leverage these capabilities to help forecast market trends, customer demands, and emerging technologies
  • Drive innovation and competitive advantage by uncovering insights from data to identify new market opportunities, innovative product ideas, or process improvements

Reporting & Visualization

  • Research and apply continuous improvement in data visualization by identifying trends and patterns to transform raw data into actionable business insights
  • Establish reporting dashboards using visualization techniques that help users quickly identify key trends and business metrics that are actionable and relevant to them
  • Develop tools and training programs for “self-serve analytics”; may include delivery of training to audiences

Data Governance

  • Document data flow, systems, and processes to improve the design, implementation, and management of business/group processes

Technology & Tools

  • Evaluate and implement digital tools that enhance data insight capabilities
  • Stay up to date with the latest BI and analytics technologies and tools

Stakeholder Collaboration

  • Partner with Marketing, Digital, and Distribution teams to create personalized client experiences by leveraging data to understand individual preferences, behaviors, and needs. Uncover insights that will allow us to create personalized product recommendations, tailored marketing messages, and customized digital experiences
  • Foster strong internal and external networks and work with and across multiple teams to achieve business objectives
  • Collaborate with cross-functional teams to understand their data needs and provide tailored solutions
  • Present insights and recommendations to senior leadership and other key stakeholders

QUALIFICATIONS

  • Proven experience building & leading a Data Science function
  • Strong understanding of the Asset Management business would be an asset
  • Typically, 9+ years of direct experience in this field or 15+ years of relevant experience and post-secondary degree (MMA, PhD, Master’s Engineering or Computer Science) or an equivalent combination of education and experience
  • Seasoned expert with extensive industry knowledge
  • Technical leader viewed as a thought leader for innovation
  • Expert level of proficiency in all aspects of advanced data & analytics tools and capabilities

We’re here to help

At BMO we are driven by a shared Purpose: Boldly Grow the Good in business and life. It calls on us to create lasting, positive change for our customers, our communities and our people. By working together, innovating and pushing boundaries, we transform lives and businesses, and power economic growth around the world.

As a member of the BMO team you are valued, respected and heard, and you have more ways to grow and make an impact. We strive to help you make an impact from day one – for yourself and our customers. We’ll support you with the tools and resources you need to reach new milestones, as you help our customers reach theirs. From in-depth training and coaching, to manager support and network-building opportunities, we’ll help you gain valuable experience, and broaden your skillset.

To find out more visit us at https://jobs.bmo.com/ca/en.

BMO is committed to an inclusive, equitable and accessible workplace. By learning from each other’s differences, we gain strength through our people and our perspectives. Accommodations are available on request for candidates taking part in all aspects of the selection process. To request accommodation, please contact your recruiter.

Note to Recruiters: BMO does not accept unsolicited resumes from any source other than directly from a candidate. Any unsolicited resumes sent to BMO, directly or indirectly, will be considered BMO property. BMO will not pay a fee for any placement resulting from the receipt of an unsolicited resume. A recruiting agency must first have a valid, written and fully executed agency agreement contract for service to submit resumes.

title: Manager, Digital Analytics - Tangerine
description:
Requisition ID: 185783

Join a purpose driven winning team, committed to results, in an inclusive and high-performing culture.

Purpose:

Join the fast based team environment at Scotiabank as a Manager, Digital Analytics. The incumbent is a tagging, data analytics and insight specialist supporting digital marketing and banking initiatives across multiple channels and platforms to help drive engagement, leads, sales and loyalty.

The successful candidate will create and tell comprehensive stories about how users behave using data. You’ll deliver analytics projects of moderate complexity, partnering with other analysts and cross-functional teams along the way. Through ongoing analysis, you will gain actionable insights that better address the business goals of our internal stakeholders.

Candidate Value Proposition
• The successful candidate will have the opportunity to collaborate with analytics, marketing and digital banking squads to help optimize the efficiency and effectiveness of digital marketing campaigns, digital banking experience, and product strategy.

Job Responsibilities:

• Develop Looker Studio dashboard in scrum setting to iteratively translate business requirement in visualization and insights
• Work with senior stakeholder to perform on-demand product/digital analytics request
• Prepare detailed documentation to outline data sources, analysis, and algorithms used and developed
• Present results to business line stakeholders and help implement real world data-driven changes
• Analyze and interpret clickstream data, providing insights to inform digital banking experience optimization and campaign strategies.
• Work with technical analytics resources to ensure tracking code is consistently applied and managed
• Be flexible and thrive in an evolving environment
• Adapt to change quickly and adjust work accordingly in a positive manner

Key Accountabilities:

• Proactively initiate, research, and perform data analysis and provide ad hoc reports to internal stakeholders on web usage, user engagement, and behavioral analytics on websites and email campaigns
• Identify patterns and trends in marketing results and online activity and report on findings
• Analyze digital marketing data and user behavior patterns to provide valuable insight and to optimize user engagement and improve the effectiveness of marketing campaigns
• Monitor site and campaign traffic and determine cross-promotion, cross-sell and lead-gen opportunities
• Assist in the development and documentation of best practices for improving operational efficiencies within the digital analytics team
• Familiarity with tag audit tools like ObservePoint and Tag Inspector
• Identify bugs and erroneous analytics tags and provide solutions to development team
• Work with Digital Channels to advise on our continually evolving digital strategy
• Ability to provide clear and concise technical direction, expertise, advice and tracking solutions to frontend developers, backend developers, and analytic teams to build tools for measurement of client platforms

Skills and Experience:
• 3+ years of proven working experience as a Digital Analyst, Digital Marketing Analyst, or similar role
• 3+ years of experience with data segmentation and reporting within Google Analytics and/or Adobe Analytics as well as experience with Google Tag Manager including setting up and configuring accounts for new websites and goals
• Working knowledge of GA4
• Proficient in building dashboards leveraging and blending data from multiple data sources, as well as extracting data from data environments such as BigQuery
• 2+ years of working experience with SQL and relational databases technologies/concepts for both
• Experience with Looker Studio and/or Power BI

Nice-To-Have Skills:
• Expertise in Google Analytics implementation using Google Tag Manager
• 2+ years of experience programming in Python or Spark
• 2+ years of experience with statistical analysis, machine learning and digital analytics (e.g., hypothesis driven analysis, and fraud/anomaly detection)
• Experience working with digital advertising platforms (Facebook Business Manager, Google Ads, DoubleClick Manager, AppNexus) and search engine optimization is an asset

Degrees or Certifications:
Bachelor’s Degree or equivalent in in STEM, or relevant field

Location(s): Canada : Ontario : Toronto

Scotiabank is a leading bank in the Americas. Guided by our purpose: "for every future", we help our customers, their families and their communities achieve success through a broad range of advice, products and services, including personal and commercial banking, wealth management and private banking, corporate and investment banking, and capital markets.

At Scotiabank, we value the unique skills and experiences each individual brings to the Bank, and are committed to creating and maintaining an inclusive and accessible environment for everyone. If you require accommodation (including, but not limited to, an accessible interview site, alternate format documents, ASL Interpreter, or Assistive Technology) during the recruitment and selection process, please let our Recruitment team know. If you require technical assistance, please click here. Candidates must apply directly online to be considered for this role. We thank all applicants for their interest in a career at Scotiabank; however, only those candidates who are selected for an interview will be contacted.

title: Data Quality Lead (Collibra)
description:
Description

Join our team & what we’ll accomplish together

The Data Strategy & Enablement team is on a continuous journey towards helping TELUS become a world-class leader in data solutions. We are doing so by delivering data analytics capabilities built upon unified scalable platforms, advanced AI tooling and high-quality data. We have a data-product and data platform-oriented culture and we are always keeping an eye on the horizon, preparing for the next big thing.

We are entrepreneurial and passionate, believers that so much more is possible and can be achieved by creating value and great outcomes for our customers, team members, communities, and environment and that through meaningful transformation we can integrate dynamic change in our professional lives.Our team members appreciate diversity of thinking, ideas and experiences, and are always learning, experimenting and applying tuition value into everything we do.

As a Trusted advisor for Data Quality Management, you’ll contribute to the adoption and advancement of TELUS’ Data Management and Data Quality Program, you will also contribute to the advancement of TELUS’ Data Quality platform maturity and adoption.

As a Subject Matter Expert in Data Management, you collaborate with various business units and demonstrate thought leadership when sitting at the intersection between business value, technology and data to ensure TELUS’ data quality platform provides a high usability platform for all data quality needs at TELUS. Growth mindset is the must for this role as we are lean and extremely adaptable team that supports all aspects of Center of Excellence practice.

What you will do

  • Establish product strategic goals and short, mid and long-term roadmap
  • Define and document what to solve first, articulate the valuable market/user problem to be addressed along with priorities and justification for each part of the solution
  • Gathers, manages, and prioritizes market/customer requirements
  • Acts as the user advocate articulating the end user’s needs
  • Work closely with engineers, architects, program managers and platform support to ensure business case, yearly targets and user satisfaction goals are met
  • Ensure that the product supports the company’s overall strategy and goals
  • Empower rapidly growing TELUS Enterprise Data Quality Management Practice user community
  • Enrich user experience for all types of users
  • In alignment with the program goals and objectives, define and drive user adoption processes by meaningful interactions and consistent application of advanced branding, marketing and communication techniques and skills to drive user engagement
  • Support and be attentive to users needs and concerns in a timely manner, alleviate user concerns in a positive manner in alignment with program vision and approach
  • Actively monitor data quality maturity trending and initiate appropriate corrective actions with responsible users and stakeholders
  • Nurture and grow user community by preparing, facilitating, coordinating and running community of practice forums; capture, manage and follow up on all action items raised; communicate outcomes as needed
  • Lead/support Collibra Data Quality Platform user training and onboarding activities for all existing and future platform components and capabilities
  • Maintain existing and development new training materials
  • Advocate for Data management and governance practice
  • Keep informed and apply data management and governance best practices

Qualifications

What you will bring

  • Expert level of understanding and demonstrable working knowledge of Collibra Data Quality platform
  • Subject matter expertise in CDQr product,including specific industry and technical knowledge
  • Expert level of understanding and demonstrable knowledge of Data Quality Management practices
  • Expert level of understanding and demonstrable knowledge of strategy and product management
  • Expert level of understanding and demonstrable knowledge of Data Governance practices
  • Strong communication & problem solving skills
  • Strong understanding of Data Management Lifecycle
  • Strong understanding of Data Lifecycle and what DQM activities are applied at each stage
  • Working knowledge with database technologies, systems , reporting tools and APIs
  • Ability to influence cross-functional teams without formal authority
  • Ability to work with Communication platforms used (gSuite, web pages, Collibra dashboards, …) hands on design and development required
  • Project management skills in order to administer, schedule, manage meeting agendas/ reviews/ MoM/communication and groups of stakeholders
  • Working knowledge of Data Management practices as per DAMA International BOK framework

Great-to-Haves

  • University degree in computer science and/or 5 years of working experience in Information Management
  • Collibra University Certification
  • Knowledge of Collibra Data Intelligence Cloud Technology
  • Demonstrable DAMA international BOK Framework knowledge and/or application
  • PMP certification
  • Fluency in speaking, reading and writing French

title: Senior Manager, Data Ethics Governance and Operations
description:
Requisition ID: 183978

Join a purpose driven winning team, committed to results, in an inclusive and high-performing culture.

Purpose:


The Customer Insights Data and Analytics (CID&A) team at Scotiabank is at the forefront of the journey to transform the Bank into a data centric organization through impactful customer insights, innovative analytics, and well-governed data. One of the main areas of transformation is the way data is used, shared, and accessed at an enterprise level. The aim is to provide transparent, robust, and ethical data practices across the enterprise to enhance the protection of our customers’ data, and the way we deliver business value. We are looking to build our delivery team with influencers, makers, creators, and industry leaders who will drive us forward.
The role of the Senior Manager, Data Ethics Governance and Operations will be responsible for:

  • Enabling the Bank’s adoption of the Data Ethics Framework with a Global scope
  • Leading definition and implementation of industry leading data ethics practices and processes
  • Supporting, facilitating, and monitoring the organization’s efforts to adhere to the Data Ethics Framework
  • Setting up the day-to-day operations of the team (e.g., reporting, metric/KPI/Audit tracking,).


We are looking for someone who will make key contributions in developing, planning, and executing the adoption of processes and tools that enable ethical data use, third party data sharing frameworks, and streamlining data access rights. This role will work closely with our legal, privacy, data office, analytics, and technology teams in the bank to design and develop the processes for the ethical use of data.

Accountabilities:

  • Implement the operating model including standards, guidelines, and frameworks to enable ethical data use
  • Work closely with representatives across the bank to ensure activities are conducted in compliance with internal policies & procedures and emerging governing regulations
  • Works in cross-functional teams, providing guidance on data ethics standards and guideline
  • Participate in discussions focused on design and implementation of best practices and tools to support Data Ethics processes
  • Oversee the review process for: Data Ethics assessments (to provide ethical guidance for analytics, including AI and ML) and Sensitive Data reviews (to determine the level of protection required for data that is moving within the bank, including in cloud technology)
  • Ensures business stakeholder understanding, alignment and commitment to the objectives of the data ethics framework
  • Review the business stakeholders’ implementation of the data ethics framework for quality assurance and compliance
  • Ensure remediation and closure of audit issues within the stipulated deadline
  • Builds strategic relationships across the organization with counterparts in Risk, Compliance, Legal and other control functions to ensure consistency and alignment on best practices across the organization
  • Participate in planning and retrospective sessions, attend stand-ups, etc. – we work in an agile environment
  • Stay abreast of emerging ethical trends and ensure activities are always delivered with a best practice and innovation approach, reflecting appropriate technological developments for competitive business position
  • Lead a high-performance team – this is a people manager role


Requirements & Qualifications:

  • 5+ years of experience in business/financial services
  • Knowledge and understanding of data governance, data policy, privacy
  • Ability to present ideas and facilitate discussions to build consensus at all levels.
  • Strong communication skills, both written and spoken
  • Ability to drive success in a high performing, flexible and small team environment
  • Strong analytical and communication skills and an ability to communicate and convey technical concepts into “layman terms”
  • Results orientation and pragmatic approach to decision making
  • Self-motivated, solution driven individual and adaptable to a fast-paced environment

Location(s): Canada : Ontario : Toronto

Scotiabank is a leading bank in the Americas. Guided by our purpose: "for every future", we help our customers, their families and their communities achieve success through a broad range of advice, products and services, including personal and commercial banking, wealth management and private banking, corporate and investment banking, and capital markets.

At Scotiabank, we value the unique skills and experiences each individual brings to the Bank, and are committed to creating and maintaining an inclusive and accessible environment for everyone. If you require accommodation (including, but not limited to, an accessible interview site, alternate format documents, ASL Interpreter, or Assistive Technology) during the recruitment and selection process, please let our Recruitment team know. If you require technical assistance, please click here. Candidates must apply directly online to be considered for this role. We thank all applicants for their interest in a career at Scotiabank; however, only those candidates who are selected for an interview will be contacted.

title: Senior Advisor, Business Insights
description:
Hours

37.5

Workplace Model

Hybrid

Pay Details

We’re committed to providing fair and equitable compensation to all our colleagues. As a candidate, we encourage you to have an open dialogue with your recruiter and ask compensation related questions, including pay details for this role.

Department Overview

What does TD Data & Analytics stand for? For starters, we believe in visionary leadership and insights.

We believe in the talent we grow to better serve our clients, and we know, many of the ground-breaking discoveries and products that represent the future at TD, can all be driven with data.

Job Details

About this Role

With your wealth of experience with data and insights, you’ll act as a top advisor to your business partners and contacts across TD. Your goal? Work positively and professionally with your partners to inspire world-class, comprehensive analytical support. As a subject matter expert on the subject, TD will look to your interpretation of vast and complex data in the form of ongoing, multidimensional insights and relevant data analysis. You’ll use all the analytics tools at your disposal – including profiling tools, segmentation and advanced modelling and analytics – to add new dimension and drive to TD’s business growth and value. Finally, you own your space and are at the top of your game when it comes to relationship building, which will be key in your partnerships across the organization.

We are looking for someone to lead and cultivate a sizeable team of Business Insights & Analytics professionals/specialists.

As a Senior Advisor, Business Insights, you will:

  • Work closely with business partners to gain deep understanding of the business and relevant objectives in order help drive the strategic direction of respective business and/or the enterprise
  • Formulate relevant data analysis through comprehensive profiling tools, segmentation, as well as using advanced modeling and analytics
  • Lead on the interpretation of complex business issues, generate multifaceted insights and find opportunities to help drive business growth or address business/enterprise needs
  • Ensure team collaboration with partners on business problems/issues and provide fact-based analytical advice that aligns to strategy and drives shareholder value
  • Generally accountable for a significant business or area that has cross business or enterprise wide impact or accountability
  • Enterprise domain/ functional expert, requiring broad managerial and deep specialized knowledge at the enterprise, business, regulatory and industry levels
  • Undertake and complete a variety of complex initiatives requiring seasoned specialist knowledge and/or the integration of cross functional processes
  • Present and communicate generated insights and recommended business actions to stakeholders/ business leaders in an easily digestible manner
  • Act as the primary contact with business to bridge and translate business requirements to analytics and reporting needs for a given domain/business
  • Apply positive relationship management efforts to constructively influence and inspire working partners where appropriate
  • Serve as an authority on a given business domain and provide business expertise to place context around analytics discovery and inform recommendations
  • Raise data/process related problems and communicate to relevant teams in a timely manner and make recommendations for resolution
  • Provides day-to-day support and delivery of analytics
  • Build insights solutions end to end (from initial demand to results/recommendation presentation) ranging in complexity
  • Enhance analytics capability by developing a “best-in-class” analytics team that delivers meaningful insights that drive measurable business value. Help make analytics a competitive advantage for TD.
  • Oversee strategies to attract, motivate and retain a highly diverse, qualified and engaged team to fulfill current and future business needs, creating and sustaining a high performing inclusive culture
  • Navigate complex organizational boundaries, stakeholder management, develop, manage and deliver on project/program plans

Job Requirements

What can you bring to TD?
Share your most relevant experience, credentials and knowledge for this role, as well as these essential requirements and attributes:
Ideal candidate will possess a broad depth of experience as a technologist in the data analytics space, with years of experience focusing on financial crimes.

  • Experience in data analysis using programming languages such as Python, SQL, R, SAS or equivalent.
  • Experience with statistical analysis and modelling.
  • Strong analytical, problem-solving, and communication skills.
  • Ability to communicate and explain analytical results.
  • Ability to work independently and collaboratively in a fast-paced environment.
  • Proficiency in cloud computing and big data platforms, such as AWS, Azure, Spark, or Hadoop.
  • Knowledge of visualization techniques, using software such as Excel, Tableau, Power BI.

Preferred candidate will posses one or more certifications within a financial crimes and accounting concentration:

  • CAMS – Certified Ani-Money Laundering Specialist
  • CFCS – Certified Financial Crime Specialist
  • CFE – Certified Fraud Examiner
  • CIA – Certified Internal Auditor
  • CPA – Chartered Professional Accountant

Company Overview

Our Values
At TD we’re guided by our purpose is to enrich the lives of our customers, communities and colleagues, and share a set of values that shape our culture and guide our behavior. In exchange for how our colleagues show up to help TD succeed, we are committed to delivering a colleague experience grounded in Impact, Growth and a Culture of Care. No matter where you work across TD, we empower you to make an impact at work and in your community, explore and grow your career and be part of our caring and inclusive culture.

Making Your Well-being a Priority
A caring and supportive culture that promotes colleague well-being is core to who we are. At TD, we focus on total well-being with extensive programs to help colleagues assess, manage, and improve their well-being across four core pillars — physical, financial, social and mental/emotional. In addition, we champion a safe, inclusive and supportive work environment to help colleagues feel a sense of belonging, and supported in their personal and professional growth. Through our focus on total well-being, we know that we can help our colleagues thrive, contribute to our culture of care, and support better business outcomes … because when colleagues feel their best, they’re more likely to do their best.

Our Total Rewards Package
Our Total Rewards package reflects the investment we make in our colleagues to help them, and their families achieve their well-being goals. Total Rewards at TD includes a base salary, variable compensation, and several other key plans such as health and well-being benefits including medical, dental, vision & mental health coverage, savings and retirement programs, paid time off, banking benefits and discounts, career development, and reward and recognition programs.

How We Work
At TD, we believe in-person connections fuel collaboration and collective creativity. Our workplace experience empowers colleagues to do great work side-by-side at TD locations, while offering flexibility to work remotely where it makes sense for the work and team. Our teams work in one of three workplace models: hybrid, onsite and primarily remote. Wherever our colleagues are working, they’ll always have access to the TD community and experience our culture of care.

Who We Are
TD is one of the world’s leading global financial institutions and is the fifth largest bank in North America by branches. Every day, we deliver legendary customer experiences to over 27 million households and businesses in Canada, the United States and around the world. More than 95,000 TD colleagues bring their skills, talent, and creativity to the Bank, those we serve, and the economies we support. We are guided by our vision to Be the Better Bank and our purpose to enrich the lives of our customers, communities and colleagues. TD is a customer obsessed organization, and we are deeply committed to being a leader in customer experience, that is why we believe that all colleagues, no matter where they work, are customer facing. As we build our business and deliver on our strategy, we are innovating to enhance the customer experience and build capabilities to shape the future of banking. Whether you’ve got years of banking experience or are just starting your career in financial services, we can help you realize your potential. Through regular leadership and development conversations to mentorship and training programs, we’re here to support you towards your goals. As an organization, we keep growing – and so will you.

Inclusiveness

Our Commitment to Diversity, Equity, and Inclusion
At TD, we’re committed to fostering an environment where all colleagues are encouraged to bring their authentic selves to work, experience equitable opportunities, and feel respected and supported. We’re dedicated to building an inclusive workforce that reflects the diversity of the customers and the communities in which we live and serve.

How We’re Helping Make an Impact in Communities
TD has a long-standing commitment to help drive progress towards a more inclusive and sustainable future. That’s why we launched the TD Ready Commitment in 2018, now a multi-year North American initiative. Under the TD Ready Commitment, we are targeting a total of $1 billion by 2030 in community giving four key, interconnected drivers of change: Financial Security, Vibrant Planet, Connected Communities, and Better Health. It’s our goal to help support change, nurture progress, and contribute to making the world a better, more inclusive place for our customers, colleagues, and communities.

Accommodation
Your accessibility is important to us. Please let us know if you’d like accommodations (including accessible meeting rooms, captioning for virtual interviews, etc.) to help us remove barriers so that you can participate throughout the interview process.

We look forward to hearing from you!

title: Data Analyst Intern/Co-op
description:
Campus Role Type

Internship/Co-Op and Summer Opportunities

Start Date

– Winter

Hours

37.5

Workplace Model

Hybrid

Department Overview

Co-op and Internship opportunities allow you to gain valuable work experience across a number of the businesses at TD. You will work with experienced colleagues, receive world class training, and be part of a community of students across TD, where you will have an impact, grow as individual and experience our culture of care.

Our Co-op/Intern Programming is offered with select Co-op and Internship roles, and is designed to help you better understand the TD business, build on critical career capabilities, and broaden your professional network. This program is designed to complement your on-the job experience and features:

  • Leadership talks with key Leaders from across the organization
  • Lunch and Learns on topics such as Innovation
  • Diversity and Inclusion and Personal Branding and so much more

Job Details

You will have the opportunity to work with one of our various teams within the DaaS group. From Day 1, you will be treated as an equal member of the team and given meaningful assignments to help us deliver improvements to our data platforms across multiple segments such as Core Banking, Business Banking, Insurance, Wealth, or Enterprise Platforms.

Job responsibilities for a junior Data Analyst may vary by area. This may include, but is not limited to the following:

  • Work with business and technology partners to define, develop and document detailed business, data and system requirements.
  • Participate as a member of agile pod team focused on developing new capabilities, including agile ceremonies.
  • Collaborate with data engineers, product owners, quality engineers and other stakeholders to deliver an end-to-end capability from concept to production-deployment.
  • Have performed data analysis, profiling, clean-up, data wrangling and validation as part of University assignments.
  • Based on data analysis, provide recommendations for data remediation, improvements.
  • Participate in program/ system research, analysis, detailed design and problem resolution.
  • Respond to user enquiries on data platform, in a timely manner.
  • Troubleshoot and determine root cause and resolution for application defects.
  • Apply Software Development Life Cycle (SDLC) and Project Management Methodology (PMLC) to complete specific tasks for projects.
  • Continuously enhance knowledge/expertise and keep up-to-date with leading-edge technologies trends/developments.
  • Develop expertise in data platform, infrastructure, data pipeline, analytical tools and design techniques that can contribute to effective solution development and delivery.
  • Good communication, interpersonal, collaboration skills to work in an agile cross-functional team, with different stakeholders.
  • Have owned, delivered a project assignment in University starting from Inception, Initiation, Execution until Implementation. Project outcome reviewed and measured as expected.

Job Requirements

  • Currently enrolled in a relevant technology programs, such as Computer Science, Engineering, Information Technology Management, Financial Analysis and Risk Management, Computing, etc.
  • Strong communication and inter-personal skills with the ability to deliver message and ideas effectively to diverse audiences such as business, development, quality engineers and management stakeholders.
  • A thirst for constantly exploring emerging technology such as Azure, python, Talend, Tableau, Informatica.
  • Familiarity with Jira and Confluence.
  • Proficient with Excel, Visio, SQL, some reporting and analytical tools.
  • Understands Data Modeling concepts.
  • Able to manage multiple priorities and work independently, as well as part of a team.
  • Experience with technology project delivery and agile delivery methodology would be an asset.
  • Some prior experience with creating visualization such as Process and Data Flows.
  • Good documentation skill; can produce data mapping between Source and Target Systems. Capture User Stories and Use Cases.
  • Hands-on programming experience would be an asset, which could include familiarity and strength in any of the following: C, C++, C#, Object C, Java, Java Script, Python, NodeJS, SQL, J2EE, Web Services, DB2, MS SQL.

Additional Information

Please note that this is a general posting. If you are selected for an interview, more information regarding which business group and the specific job duties will be provided.

Early Talent Requirements

  • This position is a 4-month work term and will commence January 8th – April 26th, 2024..
  • Applications must include a resume (maximum of 2 pages).
  • We welcome all applications; however, we will only contact qualified candidates chosen for an interview. Thank you for your interest.
  • TD requires employees to reside in Canada where the role is located. Successful candidates are expected to arrange relocation to one of our Toronto offices in a hybrid model (1-3 days per week in office).

Assigned Line of Business Requirements
Please note that the line of business that you are assigned to may require specific skills not mentioned in this posting

HOURS
Monday-Friday, standard business hours

title: Cloud/DevOps Engineer Intern/Co-op
description:
Campus Role Type

Internship/Co-Op and Summer Opportunities

Start Date

– Winter

Hours

37.5

Workplace Model

Hybrid

Department Overview

Co-op and Internship opportunities allow you to gain valuable work experience across a number of the businesses at TD. You will work with experienced colleagues, receive world class training, and be part of a community of students across TD, where you will have an impact, grow as individual and experience our culture of care.

Our Co-op/Intern Programming is offered with select Co-op and Internship roles, and is designed to help you better understand the TD business, build on critical career capabilities, and broaden your professional network. This program is designed to complement your on-the job experience and features:

  • Leadership talks with key Leaders from across the organization
  • Lunch and Learns on topics such as Innovation
  • Diversity and Inclusion and Personal Branding and so much more

Job Details

The Enterprise DevOps pipeline helps TD get to market faster on public cloud by enabling “Self-service” environment creation, and modularization of both the application and the infrastructure through the pipeline.

You will take part working and contributing towards various development work, building up new DevOps tools to enable deployment of Azure public cloud services. Day 1, you will treated as an equal member of the team and given meaningful assignments to help us deliver improvements to our technology platforms.

This may include, but is not limited to the following:

  • Work on DevOps development, design, and build, managing tools for Enterprise-wide technology including Nexus binary repository, GitHub code repository, Jenkins, CI/CD engine, Terraform, Sonarqube, & Aquasec
  • Learn to develop and write Python, Java, shell scripts and groovy code
  • Learn to setup a development environment with docker, and development tools
  • Learn about cloud security, working with various cloud security tools, policies and secrets management
  • Work with DevOps and cloud tools including GitHub, Terraform, Nexus, Jenkins, Xeebia Release & Deploy, Hashicorp Vault, Aquasec, Bitbucket
  • Gain exposure to Salt, DNS, Redhat Satellite, Datadog, Sensu, SQL, Splunk, Mongo
  • Learn cloud services including Azure machine learning, Azure SQL, Azure data lake (ADLS), Azure Kubernetes, Azure function, Azure Databrick, etc.
  • Review and assess new technologies and work through testing, validation, and integration for TD internal tools & systems
  • Continuously enhance knowledge/expertise and keep current with leading-edge technologies trends/developments and develop expertise in TD services, applications, infrastructure, analytical tools and techniques that can contribute to effective solution development/delivery

Job Requirements

  • Currently enrolled in a relevant technology programs, such as Computer Science, Engineering, Information Technology Management, Financial Analysis and Risk Management, Computing, etc.
  • Knowledge of python and/ or java programming is required
  • Ideal candidate is a well-rounded developer, with an understanding of DevOps and Cloud tools/ platforms and an enthusiasm to deepen their knowledge and expertise through hands-on experience engineering TD’s DevOps pipeline

Additional Information

Please note that this is a general posting. If you are selected for an interview, more information regarding which business group and the specific job duties will be provided.

Early Talent Requirements

  • This position is a 4-month work term and will commence January 8th – April 26th, 2024..

At TD, we’re committed to fostering an environment where all colleagues are encouraged to bring their authentic selves to work, experience equitable opportunities, and feel respected and supported. We’re dedicated to building an inclusive workforce that reflects the diversity of the customers and the communities in which we live and serve.

How We’re Helping Make an Impact in Communities
TD has a long-standing commitment to help drive progress towards a more inclusive and sustainable future. That’s why we launched the TD Ready Commitment in 2018, now a multi-year North American initiative. Under the TD Ready Commitment, we are targeting a total of $1 billion by 2030 in community giving four key, interconnected drivers of change: Financial Security, Vibrant Planet, Connected Communities, and Better Health. It’s our goal to help support change, nurture progress, and contribute to making the world a better, more inclusive place for our customers, colleagues, and communities.

Accommodation
Your accessibility is important to us. Please let us know if you’d like accommodations (including accessible meeting rooms, captioning for virtual interviews, etc.) to help us remove barriers so that you can participate throughout the interview process.

We look forward to hearing from you!

title: Associate Director, Environmental & Social Risk Analytics
description:
Come Work with Us!

At RBC, our culture is deeply supportive and rich in opportunity and reward. You will help our clients thrive and our communities prosper, empowered by a spirit of shared purpose.

Whether you’re helping clients find new opportunities, developing new technology, or providing expert advice to internal partners, you will be doing work that matters in the world, in an environment built on teamwork, service, responsibility, diversity, and integrity.

Job Title

Associate Director, Environmental & Social Risk Analytics

Job Description

What is the Opportunity?

As part of the Environmental & Social Risk Analytics team within Group Risk Management, you will play a role in the management, monitoring, and mitigation of environmental and social (E&S) risks at RBC. You will support and lead the design and implementation of key climate and E&S risk initiatives by providing research and data analytics and insights.

A significant focus of this role will be the calculation of RBC’s financed emissions across different asset classes within carbon-intensive sectors and setting and tracking progress on net-zero targets.

What will you do?

  • Work with the Director, E&S Risk Analytics to assist in the advancement of RBC’s capabilities in measuring financed emissions, setting net-zero targets, and delivering carbon accounting insights across the enterprise.
  • Support target setting through economic and industry research, making powerpoint slides and reports, and presenting research to a wide range of internal stakeholders.
  • Collaborate with diverse internal stakeholders across business lines and functions to share E&S Risk data and insights, to inform risk management, business strategy, and ESG and climate disclosures.
  • Identify opportunities to improve environmental & social risk data processes and take a leading role in implementing these changes;
  • Optimize data quality and results by seeking out public and private data sources and working with internal stakeholders to source RBC data to improve our climate risk measurement and management capabilities.
  • Lead workstreams and collaborations across multiple teams to accomplish the above
  • Contribute to the development and management of junior members of the E&S Risk Analytics teams

Must have

  • An interest in Environmental and Social Risk in general and climate change in particular
  • Experience in working in an analytics team, especially those tasked with solving difficult and/or vaguely-defined problems
  • The ability to synthesize data into business insights and communicate these clearly to diverse audiences
  • An advanced understanding of programming and querying languages, including SQL and python OR a proven ability to both code in another data analytics language (e.g. R, MATLAB, SAS) and the ability learn a new language quickly
  • Experience developing presentations, visualizations and dashboards for senior executives and an interest in developing advanced analytical capabilities
  • Demonstrated ability in mathematical, statistical, financial or economic analyses on large, complex datasets and in translating data into business insights
  • A desire and proven ability to build new and innovative approaches to complex problems with minimal direction
  • Commitment to quality and accuracy with a high level of attention to detail.
  • Excellent written and verbal communication skills.

Nice to have

  • Knowledge of climate change science with experience in the development and use of climate and economic scenarios, models, projections and data.
  • Knowledge or familiarity with the climate risk and/or target setting guidance issued by PCAF, NZBA, TCFD, ISSB, and/or OSFI (B-15)
  • Knowledge or familiarity with internal RBC wholesale lending data systems
  • Experience with or knowledge of carbon-intensive sectors, e.g. agriculture; aluminum; cement; coal; commercial and residential real estate; iron and steel; oil and gas; power generation; and transportation
  • Knowledge and experience in quantitative model development, testing and validation.
  • Experience working with a diverse range of stakeholders.
  • People manager experience

What’s in it for you?

We thrive on the challenge to be our best, progressive thinking to keep growing, and working together to deliver trusted advice to help our clients thrive and communities prosper. We care about each other, reaching our potential, making a difference to our communities, and achieving success that is mutual.

  • Leaders who support your development through coaching and managing opportunities
  • Ability to make a difference and lasting impact
  • Work in a dynamic, collaborative, progressive, and high-performing team
  • Opportunities to do challenging work and make a difference
  • Opportunities to building close relationships

Job Summary

This position will support the advancement of the bank’s Environmental and Social Risk data management, analysis and disclosure capabilities, and the integration of this data into our risk management framework.

title: Intern, Solution Engineering
description:
At CN, everydaybrings new and exciting challenges. You can expect an interesting environmentwhere you’re part of making sure ourbusiness is running optimally and safely―helping keep the economy on track. We welcome students who share theirideas, perspectives and understanding of newtechnologies withour teams. In return, we provide the opportunity towork on exciting projects with experienced collaborators who are happy to share their knowledge, all within a mutually-agreed to framework. Youwill be able to thrive in our close-knit, safety-focused culture workingtogether as ONE TEAM. The opportunities we offer are meaningful because thework we do matters. Join us!

Canadian National Railway Company (CN) is looking for a highly motivated person to fulfill a full-time (40h/week) Intern,Solution Engineering position in enter Montreal, QC for winter 2023 (January – April).

Job Summary

The Intern, Solutions Engineering is responsible for contributing to the delivery of customer solutions in collaboration with other members of the Customer and Intermodal Solutions and Innovation team who will act as coaches and mentors. The role’s path is determined based on interest and career aspiration in order for the position to be an opportunity to work in the chosen fields of interest and learn more about cutting edge cloud-based enterprise solutions and mission critical systems.

Major Responsibilities

  • Participate to solution architecture and design including defining and documenting the design of architecture of the solutions to be delivered
  • Participate in Application Program Interface (API) and µServices and databases design to meet business requirements
  • Participate in front-end layers design for both web and mobile
  • Contribute to code base for backend and frontend
  • Contribute to a code base for data transformation and enrichment
  • Document solutions and standards
  • Engage in the peer review process and pair programming
  • Automate testing and deployment with Continuous Integration (CI) and Continuous Delivery (CD) pipelines
  • Write and execute test scripts in accordance to requirements specification

Requirements

  • Knowledge or interest in full stack polyglot development (e.g., Java, Python, Javascript, Typescript, NodeJS, Angular, NativeScript, and ReactNative)
  • Knowledge or interest in databases or related programs (e.g., Structured Query Language (SQL), NoSQL, Document, GraphQL, Search - PostgreSQL, and MongoDB)
  • Knowledge or interest in modeling complex systems and data including Unified Modeling Language (UML)
  • Knowledge or interest in DevOps (e.g., Azure DevOps, GitHub, GitLab)
  • Knowledge or interest in Test automation, Test-driven development (TDD), Behavior-driven development (BDD), Acceptance test–driven development (ATDD)
  • Knowledge or interest in µService/API architecture (e.g., SpringBoot/Spring Cloud/API Gateway/ApiGee, Anthos)
  • Knowledge or interest in Distributed Systems and Enterprise Messaging Architecture (e.g. Kafka, Message Queue)
  • Knowledge or interest of cloud platform Azure and Google Cloud Platform (GCP)
  • Knowledge or interest in functional testing, performance testing and test automation

Education

  • Working towards a Bachelor’s Degree in Computer Science or Software Engineering

*Any experience/education/skills/knowledge for these above would be considered as an asset

About CN

CN is a world-class transportation leader and trade-enabler. Essential to the economy, to the customers, and to the communities it serves, CN safely transports more than 300 million tons of natural resources, manufactured products, and finished goods throughout North America every year. As the only railroad connecting Canada’s Eastern and Western coasts with the Southern tip of the U.S. through a 19,500 mile rail network, CN and its affiliates have been contributing to community prosperity and sustainable trade since 1919. CN is committed to programs supporting social responsibility and environmental stewardship. At CN, we work as ONE TEAM, focused on safety, sustainability and our customers, providing operational and supply chain excellence to deliver results.

CN is an employment equity employer and we encourage all qualified candidates to apply. We thank all applicants for their interest, however, only candidates under consideration will be contacted. Please monitor your email on a regular basis, as communication is primarily made through email.

title: GRM, Risk Analyst Intern
description:
Come Work with Us!

At RBC, our culture is deeply supportive and rich in opportunity and reward. You will help our clients thrive and our communities prosper, empowered by a spirit of shared purpose.

Whether you’re helping clients find new opportunities, developing new technology, or providing expert advice to internal partners, you will be doing work that matters in the world, in an environment built on teamwork, service, responsibility, diversity, and integrity.

Job Title

GRM, Risk Analyst Intern

Job Description

What is the opportunity?

The Market Risk group provides independent and effective on-site monitoring, controlling and communicating on the nature and extent of all material market and trading credit risks and to ensure the implementation of and compliance with risk management policies and procedures. The incumbent will lead in developing and promoting a “Best in Class” risk oversight environment for the market risk associated with RBC’s Commodities Trading business and activities

What will you do?

  • Oversee and enhance risk control processes for Local market risk: Develop key sensitivity metrics, implement metrics and establish risk reporting; establish and implement appropriate limits to ensure that business is operating within approved policies and limits; identify supplementary risk controls that may be required to manage the risks and exposure as necessary
  • Monitor trading activities and exposures to ensure they are within approved policies and limits, and that reports are timely and accurate.
  • Provide insights and commentary on key risks and exposures versus market trends and potential events.
  • Work on a particular project to improve the market risk framework.

What do you need to succeed?

Must-have

  • A Master’s degree in Finance, Economics or a Quantitative subject
  • Knowledge of market risk concepts (sensitivity analysis, VaR, stress testing etc.)
  • Knowledge of financial products: Forwards, Swaps, Options.
  • Strong written and oral communication skills with the ability to condense complex details into narratives suitable for communication with senior risk and business management
  • Sufficiency in Excel-VBA, and other programming languages like Python and/or SQL.

Nice-to-have

  • Proven experience with Python and SQL.
  • Knowledge of commodity markets (Oil, Natural Gas, Precious and Base Metals, etc).

What’s in it for you?

We thrive on the challenge to be our best, progressive thinking to keep growing, and working together to deliver trusted advice to help our clients thrive and communities prosper. We care about each other, reaching our potential, making a difference to our communities, and achieving success that is mutual.

  • Leaders who support your development through coaching and managing opportunities
  • Ability to make a difference and lasting impact
  • Work in a dynamic, collaborative, progressive, and high-performing team
  • Opportunities to do challenging work and make a difference
  • Opportunities to building close relationships
  • Opportunity to learn variety of asset classes within RBC business units
  • Opportunity to learn and lead comprehensive and amalgamated ’commodities businesses and strategies’ within Market Risk
  • Potential to utilize transferable skills and grow within other related business areas

Please note: This posting is for a 4-months Winter 2024 Student placement with a start date of January 2024, and end date of April 2024. In order to be eligible for this 4-months Student position, you must either:

  • Be returning back to school after the work term end-date of April 2024 ; or
  • If you are not returning back to school (i.e. are graduating in April 2024), you must require the full 4-months work term as a mandatory component to in order to graduate successfully.

Please ensure that you meet these eligibility requirements before applying - candidates who apply but are found to be ineligible are not able to be considered.

We encourage you to apply as soon as possible as we accept applications on a rolling basis, but please note that the formal application deadline is October 6, 2023. Should you be selected to progress, someone from our team will reach out directly to provide instructions on next steps. Otherwise, feel free to check for progress updates by logging in to your RBC profile. If the status has not changed, it denotes the fact that your application is still under review.

RBC is committed to supporting flexible work arrangements when and where available. The successful candidate for this role will be required to be located within Ontario for the duration of the work term. Details regarding the specific virtual, hybrid, and in-office arrangements for this Integrated Learning/ Co-op position are to be discussed with the Hiring Manager.

Job Summary

Implements market risk analysis and participates in implementing risk management systems and processes to minimize market risk. Applies complete knowledge, skills, and practices to perform assignments.

title: Data Analyst, Investment Finance
description:
The Data Analyst will be part of the Toronto based Financial Systems & Workflows Team within the Investment Finance Division, reporting to the Manager, Financial Systems & Workflow. The DataAanalyst will support the development of the portfolio analytics capabilities and support BI solutions for the Investment Finance team and its stakeholders to make informed decisions. The Data Analyst will work with various datasets, employ various data analysis techniques, and communicate their findings to stakeholders. To succeed in this role, the ideal individual needs a strong attention to detail and be a team player with a proven ability to build relationships between the business groups. A keen desire to explore new technologies and implement innovative solutions will enhance the success of the role.

CORE RESPONSIBILITIES:

  • Design and develop comprehensive dashboards and reporting leveraging Power BI or similar business intelligence tools
  • Work across functional areas to understand and identify reporting objectives to develop relevant reporting capabilities
  • Collect, cleanse, and process data sets from various sources, including databases, spreadsheets and external sources to ensure accuracy and consistency
  • Identify, analyze, interpret and report on trends or patterns in data sets
  • Review extracts, reports, printouts, and performance indicators to identify, troubleshoot and resolve problems, including data quality, data integrity issues, and follow the divisional data governance policies
  • Explore data sets and draw meaningful conclusions and insights, including identifying critical metrics and KPIs
  • Evaluate, analyze, and recommend potential solutions that enhance analytics and reporting
  • Conduct gap analysis to identify and recommend process improvements that affect data quality
  • Investigate, evaluate and/or propose solutions to identified problems
  • Collaborate with cross-functional teams, including finance, accounting, and IT, to address data-related challenges

QUALIFICATIONS:

  • 3+ years of experience in financial management and investment support environment with exposure to relevant applications and workflow activities
  • University degree in Accounting, Finance, Mathematics, Computer Science, or related discipline
  • Experience with data visualization tools like Power BI, or data visualization libraries
  • Strong proficiency in data analysis tools and programming languages, such as Alteryx, SQL Python or others
  • Strong communication skills (written and verbal) to effectively convey complex findings to non-technical stakeholders
  • Experience in defining, implementing, and supporting innovative business solutions
  • Familiarity with database systems and data storage technologies
  • Experience with machine learning and predictive modeling is an asset
  • Ability to maintain an innovative mindset focused on delivering business value in a fast-paced and dynamic environment

#LI-Hybrid

Our story:

Founded in 1962, OMERS is one of Canada’s largest defined benefit pension plans, with $127.4 billion in net assets as at June 30, 2023. OMERS is a jointly-sponsored pension plan, with more than 1,000 participating employers ranging from large cities to local agencies, and over half a million active, deferred and retired members. OMERS members include union and non-union employees of municipalities, school boards, local boards, transit systems, electrical utilities, emergency services and children’s aid societies across Ontario. Contributions to the Plan are funded equally by members and employers. OMERS teams work in Toronto, London, New York, Amsterdam, Luxembourg, Singapore, Sydney and other major cities across North America and Europe – serving members and employers and originating and managing a diversified portfolio of high-quality investments in public markets, private equity, infrastructure and real estate.

OMERS is committed to having a workforce that reflects the communities in which we live and work. We are an equal opportunity employer committed to a barrier-free recruitment and selection process. At OMERS inclusion and diversity means belonging. How we create a sense of belonging is through our employees and our vast network of Employee Resource Groups. Whether you are passionate about gender, pride, or visible minorities, we have groups that are focused on making a difference in all of our lives.

title: Head, Business Intelligence & Insights
description:
Application Deadline:

10/09/2023

Address:

100 King Street West

Job Family Group:

Data Analytics & Reporting

As Head, Business Intelligence & Insights, you will play a crucial role in shaping our strategic direction by leveraging data to help senior leadership make informed decisions, manage risks, and drive innovation. You will lead a high-performing team and implement business intelligence initiatives that will help BMO Global Asset Management (GAM) deliver an optimal client experience, grow revenue, and drive efficiency. This role requires a leader who is strategic minded, has exceptional technical skills, and has a proven track record of success in building advanced analytics teams and capabilities.

KEY RESPONSIBILITIES

Leadership & Strategy

  • Develop and execute the vision and roadmap for Business Intelligence & Insights capabilities to support BMO GAM growth strategy
  • Collaborate with senior leadership to identify opportunities for data-driven growth and efficiency improvements

Team management

  • Lead and mentor a team of analysts, data scientists, and business intelligence professionals
  • Foster a culture of continuous improvement, innovation, and learning

Insights & Analysis

  • Leverage advanced analytics capabilities (predictive, prescriptive, and machine learning) to uncover patterns, trends, and insights that may not be apparent through traditional descriptive or diagnostic analytics. Leverage these capabilities to help forecast market trends, customer demands, and emerging technologies
  • Drive innovation and competitive advantage by uncovering insights from data to identify new market opportunities, innovative product ideas, or process improvements

Reporting & Visualization

  • Research and apply continuous improvement in data visualization by identifying trends and patterns to transform raw data into actionable business insights
  • Establish reporting dashboards using visualization techniques that help users quickly identify key trends and business metrics that are actionable and relevant to them
  • Develop tools and training programs for “self-serve analytics”; may include delivery of training to audiences

Data Governance

  • Document data flow, systems, and processes to improve the design, implementation, and management of business/group processes

Technology & Tools

  • Evaluate and implement digital tools that enhance data insight capabilities
  • Stay up to date with the latest BI and analytics technologies and tools

Stakeholder Collaboration

  • Partner with Marketing, Digital, and Distribution teams to create personalized client experiences by leveraging data to understand individual preferences, behaviors, and needs. Uncover insights that will allow us to create personalized product recommendations, tailored marketing messages, and customized digital experiences
  • Foster strong internal and external networks and work with and across multiple teams to achieve business objectives
  • Collaborate with cross-functional teams to understand their data needs and provide tailored solutions
  • Present insights and recommendations to senior leadership and other key stakeholders

QUALIFICATIONS

  • Proven experience building & leading a Data Science function
  • Strong understanding of the Asset Management business would be an asset
  • Typically, 9+ years of direct experience in this field or 15+ years of relevant experience and post-secondary degree (MMA, PhD, Master’s Engineering or Computer Science) or an equivalent combination of education and experience
  • Seasoned expert with extensive industry knowledge
  • Technical leader viewed as a thought leader for innovation
  • Expert level of proficiency in all aspects of advanced data & analytics tools and capabilities

We’re here to help

At BMO we are driven by a shared Purpose: Boldly Grow the Good in business and life. It calls on us to create lasting, positive change for our customers, our communities and our people. By working together, innovating and pushing boundaries, we transform lives and businesses, and power economic growth around the world.

As a member of the BMO team you are valued, respected and heard, and you have more ways to grow and make an impact. We strive to help you make an impact from day one – for yourself and our customers. We’ll support you with the tools and resources you need to reach new milestones, as you help our customers reach theirs. From in-depth training and coaching, to manager support and network-building opportunities, we’ll help you gain valuable experience, and broaden your skillset.

To find out more visit us at https://jobs.bmo.com/ca/en.

BMO is committed to an inclusive, equitable and accessible workplace. By learning from each other’s differences, we gain strength through our people and our perspectives. Accommodations are available on request for candidates taking part in all aspects of the selection process. To request accommodation, please contact your recruiter.

Note to Recruiters: BMO does not accept unsolicited resumes from any source other than directly from a candidate. Any unsolicited resumes sent to BMO, directly or indirectly, will be considered BMO property. BMO will not pay a fee for any placement resulting from the receipt of an unsolicited resume. A recruiting agency must first have a valid, written and fully executed agency agreement contract for service to submit resumes.

title: Manager, Digital Analytics - Tangerine
description:
Requisition ID: 185783

Join a purpose driven winning team, committed to results, in an inclusive and high-performing culture.

Purpose:

Join the fast based team environment at Scotiabank as a Manager, Digital Analytics. The incumbent is a tagging, data analytics and insight specialist supporting digital marketing and banking initiatives across multiple channels and platforms to help drive engagement, leads, sales and loyalty.

The successful candidate will create and tell comprehensive stories about how users behave using data. You’ll deliver analytics projects of moderate complexity, partnering with other analysts and cross-functional teams along the way. Through ongoing analysis, you will gain actionable insights that better address the business goals of our internal stakeholders.

Candidate Value Proposition
• The successful candidate will have the opportunity to collaborate with analytics, marketing and digital banking squads to help optimize the efficiency and effectiveness of digital marketing campaigns, digital banking experience, and product strategy.

Job Responsibilities:

• Develop Looker Studio dashboard in scrum setting to iteratively translate business requirement in visualization and insights
• Work with senior stakeholder to perform on-demand product/digital analytics request
• Prepare detailed documentation to outline data sources, analysis, and algorithms used and developed
• Present results to business line stakeholders and help implement real world data-driven changes
• Analyze and interpret clickstream data, providing insights to inform digital banking experience optimization and campaign strategies.
• Work with technical analytics resources to ensure tracking code is consistently applied and managed
• Be flexible and thrive in an evolving environment
• Adapt to change quickly and adjust work accordingly in a positive manner

Key Accountabilities:

• Proactively initiate, research, and perform data analysis and provide ad hoc reports to internal stakeholders on web usage, user engagement, and behavioral analytics on websites and email campaigns
• Identify patterns and trends in marketing results and online activity and report on findings
• Analyze digital marketing data and user behavior patterns to provide valuable insight and to optimize user engagement and improve the effectiveness of marketing campaigns
• Monitor site and campaign traffic and determine cross-promotion, cross-sell and lead-gen opportunities
• Assist in the development and documentation of best practices for improving operational efficiencies within the digital analytics team
• Familiarity with tag audit tools like ObservePoint and Tag Inspector
• Identify bugs and erroneous analytics tags and provide solutions to development team
• Work with Digital Channels to advise on our continually evolving digital strategy
• Ability to provide clear and concise technical direction, expertise, advice and tracking solutions to frontend developers, backend developers, and analytic teams to build tools for measurement of client platforms

Skills and Experience:
• 3+ years of proven working experience as a Digital Analyst, Digital Marketing Analyst, or similar role
• 3+ years of experience with data segmentation and reporting within Google Analytics and/or Adobe Analytics as well as experience with Google Tag Manager including setting up and configuring accounts for new websites and goals
• Working knowledge of GA4
• Proficient in building dashboards leveraging and blending data from multiple data sources, as well as extracting data from data environments such as BigQuery
• 2+ years of working experience with SQL and relational databases technologies/concepts for both
• Experience with Looker Studio and/or Power BI

Nice-To-Have Skills:
• Expertise in Google Analytics implementation using Google Tag Manager
• 2+ years of experience programming in Python or Spark
• 2+ years of experience with statistical analysis, machine learning and digital analytics (e.g., hypothesis driven analysis, and fraud/anomaly detection)
• Experience working with digital advertising platforms (Facebook Business Manager, Google Ads, DoubleClick Manager, AppNexus) and search engine optimization is an asset

Degrees or Certifications:
Bachelor’s Degree or equivalent in in STEM, or relevant field

Location(s): Canada : Ontario : Toronto

Scotiabank is a leading bank in the Americas. Guided by our purpose: "for every future", we help our customers, their families and their communities achieve success through a broad range of advice, products and services, including personal and commercial banking, wealth management and private banking, corporate and investment banking, and capital markets.

At Scotiabank, we value the unique skills and experiences each individual brings to the Bank, and are committed to creating and maintaining an inclusive and accessible environment for everyone. If you require accommodation (including, but not limited to, an accessible interview site, alternate format documents, ASL Interpreter, or Assistive Technology) during the recruitment and selection process, please let our Recruitment team know. If you require technical assistance, please click here. Candidates must apply directly online to be considered for this role. We thank all applicants for their interest in a career at Scotiabank; however, only those candidates who are selected for an interview will be contacted.

title: Manager, Quantitative Analysis
description:

10/12/2023

The Quantitative Analysis and Strategy (QAS) team works closely with Corporate Treasury internal Structured Market Risk, Liquidity & Funding, and Portfolio Management partners and Lines of Business partners across the bank in identifying and quantifying risks and opportunities through analytical support and statistical model development.
